articles.headline: ‘This Is About Justice’: Biden Ties Economic Revival to Racial Equity
articles.snippet: In the last of four proposals laying out his vision for economic recovery, Joseph R. Biden Jr. pledged to lift up minority-owned businesses and to award them more federal contracts.
articles.abstract: In the last of four proposals laying out his vision for economic recovery, Joseph R. Biden Jr. pledged to lift up minority-owned businesses and to award them more federal contracts.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — Joseph R. Biden Jr. unveiled wide-ranging plans on Tuesday to address systemic racism in the nation’s economy, saying this year’s election was about “understanding people’s struggles” and pledging to tear down barriers for minority-owned businesses.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan and Katie Glueck

articles.headline: From the Start, Federal Agents Demanded a Role in Suppressing Anti-Racism Protests
articles.snippet: Twin government memos show how a gung-ho federal law enforcement response to anti-racism protests may have been driven by a shaky understanding of the demonstrations’ roots.
articles.abstract: Twin government memos show how a gung-ho federal law enforcement response to anti-racism protests may have been driven by a shaky understanding of the demonstrations’ roots.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From the earliest days of the recent protests against police brutality and racism, some top federal law enforcement officials viewed the demonstrators with alarm and called for an aggressive federal response that two months later continues to escalate.
articles.byline: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs, Sergio Olmos, Mike Baker and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: Barr Clashes With House Democrats, Defending Responses to Protests and Russia Inquiry
articles.snippet: The deployment of federal agents to confront protesters and rioters and attacks on the Russia investigation highlighted a contentious hearing.
articles.abstract: The deployment of federal agents to confront protesters and rioters and attacks on the Russia investigation highlighted a contentious hearing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Attorney General William P. Barr vigorously defended the federal response to nationwide protests and civil unrest in a combative congressional hearing on Tuesday where Democrats accused him and other Trump administration officials of suppressing protesters’ rights in an overly violent crackdown.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: A Wrinkle in Stores’ Mask Policies: Enforcement
articles.snippet: A number of large retailers have said that all customers must wear masks, but some employees have been told they cannot force those who refuse.
articles.abstract: A number of large retailers have said that all customers must wear masks, but some employees have been told they cannot force those who refuse.
articles.lead_paragraph: Christopher Vanderpool works shifts as a “health ambassador” at a Walmart in Fayetteville, N.C., For $11 an hour, he stands in the parking lot asking customers to put on masks before entering the store.

articles.headline: How to Fight Against Big Tech’s Power
articles.snippet: We are beholden to a few Big Tech overlords for much of our digital lives. We can be more conscientious about it.
articles.abstract: We are beholden to a few Big Tech overlords for much of our digital lives. We can be more conscientious about it.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the morning, you check email. At noon, you browse social media and message friends. In the evening, you listen to music while shopping online. Around bedtime, you curl up with an e-book.

articles.headline: As the Pandemic Forced Layoffs, C.E.O.s Gave Up Little
articles.snippet: Some corporate bosses offered to cut their pay, but most did not. Those who did gave up less than 10 percent of what they received last year.
articles.abstract: Some corporate bosses offered to cut their pay, but most did not. Those who did gave up less than 10 percent of what they received last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the pandemic prompted companies to furlough or lay off thousands of employees, some chief executives decided to show solidarity by forgoing some of their pay.

articles.headline: Federal Agencies Agree to Withdraw From Portland, With Conditions
articles.snippet: Gov. Kate Brown of Oregon said the teams would begin a withdrawal on Thursday. Federal officials cautioned that they would withdraw only when they were confident the federal courthouse could be secured.
articles.abstract: Gov. Kate Brown of Oregon said the teams would begin a withdrawal on Thursday. Federal officials cautioned that they would withdraw only when they were confident the federal courthouse could be secured.
articles.lead_paragraph: For days, as fireworks and tear gas erupted in the streets of Portland, Ore., during the deployment of federal tactical teams cracking down on raucous demonstrations, President Trump campaigned against protesters he described as “sick and deranged anarchists & agitators” who he said had threatened to leave Portland “burned and beaten to the ground.”
articles.byline: By Mike Baker and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
